intro: Euphrasia hispida, commonly known as the hairy eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Euphrasia hispida is often found in disturbed soils and can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
